subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Netflix: From Red Envelopes to Global Domination
description: A quick win: understand Netflix: From Red Envelopes to Global Domination.

hook.text: In 1997, Reed Hastings returned a VHS tape to Blockbuster and was charged a $40 late fee. He got furious.

buildup.text: Hastings launched Netflixâ€”DVDs by mail with no late fees. Blockbuster laughed and called it a niche hobby.

discovery.text: When broadband spread, Hastings pivoted to streaming. Blockbuster, chained to 9,000 stores, couldn't follow.

twist.text: Blockbuster was offered the chance to buy Netflix for $50 million in 2000. Their CEO literally laughed in the room.

climax.text: Blockbuster filed for bankruptcy in 2010. Netflix is now worth over $250 billion and produces Oscar-winning films.

punchline.text: A $40 late fee created a $250 billion competitor.

quiz.question: What critical mistake did Blockbuster make regarding Netflix?
options: Blockbuster invested too heavily in its own streaming service too early
Blockbuster declined to buy Netflix for $50 million and dismissed it as a niche hobby
Blockbuster sued Netflix for patent infringement and lost
